file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
The Allusis was returned safely to Coruscant, Master Satele. Clan Varad no longer poses a threat.
Repairing the damage those Mandalorians inflicted will take time--but the Allusis will now assist that process.
The SIS intercepted another transmission from Darth Malgus to the Grand Moff. I thought you should see it....
The Republic showed unanticipated initiative. Our inability to secure their warship for the Empire is regrettable, but the rebellious Mandalorians were punished.
I am gathering intelligence on the Republic agents who destroyed Clan Varad. Such formidable opposition must be dealt with.
Sounds like we just went to the top of the Empire's "to kill" list.
We should watch our backs.
We know the Empire has spies in Republic space. They'll be tracking your activities.
"Formidable opposition"? He doesn't know the half of it. The Empire's days are numbered.
Understatement of the year!
I'm concerned for your safety--and what Malgus's statement implies.
We shouldn't give him any time to investigate. Now is the time to take him out.
Let's kill him first.
I don't question your ability, but that Sith is an entirely different threat from what you're used to.
Judging by his transmission, Darth Malgus is determined to make examples of you. Take extra precautions.
Thank you for your service. You saved many lives today. May the Force be with you.
The tone of this transmission indicates the Empire has plans to break our treaty. The Republic is not prepared for another war.
Do everything in your power to preserve the peace for as long as possible. May the Force be with you.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
Master Satele, come in. We have arrived at Carrick Station. Brief us on the situation.
So few have answered my call, but time is not our ally. We must act quickly.
A Mandalorian clan attacked and hijacked our warship "Allusis" while it was undergoing refit at the Fondor shipyards. They're using the vessel to raid defenseless Outer Rim systems.
There's a bigger enemy behind this. Mandalorians don't sneeze without the Empire's permission.
It's the Empire's doing.
We thought the same--at first.
I don't recognize that starship's designation. Someone famous?
Allusis? An odd name.
Allusis was a great Jedi who sacrificed himself at the Battle of Bothawui. The Republic honors his memory, but the Mandalorians are disgracing it.
How did the Mandalorians manage to capture a Republic warship? Where was the crew?
How did they steal it from us?
Only a fraction of the crew was aboard. The shipyard's security forces were taken by surprise and overwhelmed.
The Mandalorians are inflicting heavy casualties and extorting tributes from the conquered worlds. They're demanding weapons, medical supplies--even food.
But once their victims hand everything over, the Mandalorians jettison their plunder out the Allusis's air lock.
The Mandalorians have been a scourge in our galaxy for too long. It's time they faced justice.
They'll pay for their crimes.
We aren't facing the entire Mandalorian people--only a faction.
The Republic has a responsibility to those victims. The Mandalorians are attacking them using our weapons.
We must end these raids.
The Republic's reputation is not the only one that has been damaged.
Sounds like those bucket-heads are conducting psychological warfare.
Interesting war strategy.
These attacks are making a point: No one is safe.
Exactly where would someone salvage all this loot? I ask purely for humanitarian reasons.
Any chance I can recover that?
The lost wealth of these worlds is not our concern right now. We must end these unprovoked attacks.
Why would these raiders demand tribute and then throw it all away?
That makes no sense.
Wealth is not their goal. They're sowing terror and chaos to provoke a conflict.
These victims have to stop giving in to the Mandalorians.
No reason to bow down, then.
They have no choice. Worlds that resist suffer greater devastation.
The raiders are a group of rogue Mandalorians from an especially militant clan called Varad. They've broken away from the Empire and Mandalore's leadership.
Clan Varad is also attacking Imperial planets--and the Empire wants revenge. Fortunately, its fleet has been unable to destroy the Allusis.
If the Allusis attacked Imperial worlds and survived, it must be quite a ship.
That's one tough starship.
Our engineers had just upgraded the vessel with advanced shields and weaponry when it was stolen.
Do we have any idea where the Mandalorians are headed?
How do we find it?
Long-range scouts found the Allusis at a remote refueling depot. Unfortunately, Imperials have also discovered this location.
What kind of forces are the Empire committing to this?
Do we know the Empire's plans?
Republic spies just intercepted a coded transmission sent to the Imperial Grand Moff by a Sith Lord named Darth Malgus. The news isn't good....
Mandalore's scouts have tracked their rebellious brethren to the Tamarin Sector. An Imperial strike team is on its way to board Clan Varad's vessel.
We will terminate the traitors, capture the Republic's warship and add it to the Empire's arsenal.
The Allusis must not be captured by the Empire. We need its shield and weapons technology for our own defense.
If you need a team to capture that ship, you're talking to the right people.
Then let's take it back.
It's only one ship--and I assume we still have the technical readouts for those weapons and shields.
Can't we just replace it?
It isn't that simple. The Republic's resources are at all-time lows.
What do you know about Lord Mashface? He seemed friendly.
Who was that ugly Sith we saw?
Darth Malgus is a deadly and resilient foe. I faced him when the Sith Empire first returned to Republic space. He killed my Master.
Our only hope is to board the Allusis, defeat Clan Varad and fly back to Coruscant before Darth Malgus's agents beat us to it.
Thwarting Sith Lords is my specialty, Master Satele. Mandalorians shouldn't pose any greater threat.
The Force is with me.
Clan Varad's warriors specialize in fighting Jedi. Don't underestimate them.
Imperial forces are used to having Mandalorians for support, not adversaries. Our foes will be at a disadvantage.
The Empire won't have it easy.
That may be, but your fight will be much harder against two enemies. Better to get there first.
Havoc Squad is trained for boarding actions. Those Mandalorians won't know what hit them.
I'm locked, loaded and ready.
Be careful. The Mandalorians will be ready.
I know a thing or two about stealing starships. No matter how big they are, the principle is the same.
Leave it to me.
I fear your task will be considerably more complex than reprogramming a navigation computer. Be careful.
I'm already not liking this.
The risk will be considerable, but I would never send you into certain death.
Just let them try.
Do not focus on revenge. Your first duty is to capture the Allusis with minimal damage.
I'm leading an attack fleet to your target's coordinates. Our ships will distract the Mandalorians so you can safely board the Allusis.
Your assault shuttle is waiting in the station docking bay. May the Force be with you.
[Start Veteran Mode]
[This holoterminal is offline.]
[Start Master Mode]
